protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
description: This is the quick version of the Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit Protocol (NEB #T1020). For the full protocol, please click here.
before_start:
Add 4 volumes of ethanol (≥ 95%) to one volume of DNA Wash Buffer. 
  • For 50-prep kit, add 20 ml of ethanol to 5 ml of Monarch DNA Wash Buffer
  • For 250-prep kit, add 100 ml of ethanol to 25 ml of Monarch DNA Wash Buffer
All centrifugation steps should be carried out at 16,000 x g (~13,000 RPM).

Please note: column holds 800 μl
keywords: Extracting, Monarch DNA Gel Extracting Kit, extracting dna
guidelines:
For detailed protocol and more information, visit www.neb.com/T1020

The full protocol is available here. 

A video protocol is available here.

components.data: Excise the DNA fragment from the agarose gel, taking care to trim excess agarose. Transfer to a 1.5 ml microfuge tube and weigh the gel slice. Minimize exposure to UV light.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Excise the DNA fragment from the agarose gel, taking care to trim excess agarose. Transfer to a 1.5 ml microfuge tube and weigh the gel slice. Minimize exposure to UV light.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Quick Protocol for Monarch™ DNA Gel Extraction Kit
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.annotation: Trim/remove excess agarose and minimize exposure to UV light.
source_data.thread_text: Trim/remove excess agarose and minimize exposure to UV light.
source_data.body: Trim/remove excess agarose and minimize exposure to UV light.

components.data: Add 4 volumes of Gel Dissolving Buffer to the gel slice (e.g., 400 μl buffer per 100 μl or 100 mg agarose).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 4 volumes of Gel Dissolving Buffer to the gel slice (e.g., 400 μl buffer per 100 μl or 100 mg agarose).

components.data: Incubate the sample between 37–55°C (typically 50°C), until the gel slice is completely dissolved (generally 5–10 minutes).  The time that takes a gel slice to melt depends on the size of the slice, the temperature used in the incubation as well as the percent agarose used in the gel.  The time recommended above should be used just as a guideline.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the sample between 37–55°C (typically 50°C), until the gel slice is completely dissolved (generally 5–10 minutes).  The time that takes a gel slice to melt depends on the size of the slice, the temperature used in the incubation as well as the percent agarose used in the gel.  The time recommended above should be used just as a guideline.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Quick Protocol for Monarch™ DNA Gel Extraction Kit
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.annotation: For DNA fragments > 8 kb, an additional 1.5 volumes of water should be added after the slice is dissolved to mitigate the tighter binding of larger pieces of DNA (e.g., 100 μl gel slice: 400 μl Gel Dissolving Buffer: 150 μl water).
source_data.thread_text: For DNA fragments > 8 kb, an additional 1.5 volumes of water should be added after the slice is dissolved to mitigate the tighter binding of larger pieces of DNA (e.g., 100 μl gel slice: 400 μl Gel Dissolving Buffer: 150 μl water).
source_data.body: For DNA fragments > 8 kb, an additional 1.5 volumes of water should be added after the slice is dissolved to mitigate the tighter binding of larger pieces of DNA (e.g., 100 μl gel slice: 400 μl Gel Dissolving Buffer: 150 μl water).

components.data: Insert column into collection tube and load sample onto the column. Spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g, then discard flow-through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Insert column into collection tube and load sample onto the column. Spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g, then discard flow-through.

components.data: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer (with ethanol added) and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer (with ethanol added) and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional.

components.data: Repeat Step 5 (Step 5: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat Step 5 (Step 5: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add 200 μl DNA Wash Buffer and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g. Discarding flow-through is optional).

components.data: Transfer column to a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer column to a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Quick Protocol for Monarch™ DNA Gel Extraction Kit
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.annotation: Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute.
source_data.thread_text: Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute.
source_data.body: Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute.

components.data: Add ≥ 6 μl of DNA Elution Buffer to the center of the matrix. Wait for 1 minute, and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g to elute the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add ≥ 6 μl of DNA Elution Buffer to the center of the matrix. Wait for 1 minute, and spin for 1 minute at 16,000 x g to elute the DNA.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 8 of Quick Protocol for Monarch™ DNA Gel Extraction Kit
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB #T1020)
source_data.annotation: Typical elution volumes are 6–20 μl. Nuclease-free water (pH 7–8.5) can also be used to elute the DNA. Yield may slightly increase if a larger volume of DNA Elution Buffer is used, but the DNA will be less concentrated. For larger size DNA (≥ 10 kb), heating the elution buffer to 50°C prior to use can improve yield.
source_data.thread_text: Typical elution volumes are 6–20 μl. Nuclease-free water (pH 7–8.5) can also be used to elute the DNA. Yield may slightly increase if a larger volume of DNA Elution Buffer is used, but the DNA will be less concentrated. For larger size DNA (≥ 10 kb), heating the elution buffer to 50°C prior to use can improve yield.

Yield may slightly increase if a larger volume of DNA Elution Buffer is used, but the DNA will be less concentrated. For larger size DNA (≥ 10 kb), heating the elution buffer to 50°C prior to use can improve yield.
